meanings.definition: A person who fails to fulfill a commitment or obligation.
meanings.sent1: The flaker promised to help but never showed up.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a flaker and always keep your promises.
meanings.sent3: The flaker said they would bring snacks, but they forgot.
meanings.sent4: Being a flaker is like being a broken promise.
meanings.sent5: The image of a flaker is someone who can't be relied upon.

meanings.definition: A small, thin piece of a material that has come off a larger piece.
meanings.sent1: She found a flaker of paint on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The cake had a flaker of chocolate on top.
meanings.sent3: The flaker of paper fluttered in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Each flaker of snow added to the winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The flaker of wood fell from the old chair.
